comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: May Palmer was the daughter of banker Henry Palmer, of New York, Paris, and London; she married Senator Depew (as his second wife) at the American Church in Nice (Protestant service) and at Notre Dame de Paris (Catholic service) in December 1901, when he was 68 and she was... significantly younger. May was widowed in 1928, and died in 1940. A few years after she died, the Government of India leased her former house in Washington DC to use as its Embassy in the US. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chauncey_Depew en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Embassy_of_India_in_Washington Mary Palmer Depew gave a significant donation to George Washington University in her husband's memory, to establish a department of public speaking. She endowed a Chair in Public Speaking, which is now known as the Chauncey M. Depew Professor of Communication. Depew's papers are mainly at GWU: www.gwu.edu/gelman/spec/ead/ms2095.xml
